title: The False Measure
description: Investigate the merchant Kyriakos who cheats the poor with false weights

objectives.description: Find the merchant Kyriakos in the market
Watch how Kyriakos conducts his business

journal.start: Chrysostom asked me to investigate a grain merchant named Kyriakos. He's heard rumors of dishonest practices. My past makes me well-suited for this work.
journal.found_merchant: I found Kyriakos in the market. He sells grain at high prices and treats the poor with contempt.
journal.evidence_weights: I caught Kyriakos using a false-bottom scoop. The poor are getting less grain than they pay for.
journal.evidence_gouging: I watched Kyriakos raise prices on an old woman. He blamed 'supply problems' while sitting on mountains of grain.
journal.complete: Chrysostom heard my report. He's planning a sermon. The rich may smile at his words, but they can't hide from the truth forever.

choice.journal: Kyriakos tried to buy my silence. I refused. Old habits die hard, but they can die.

thematicNotes.orthodoxTeaching: Chrysostom preached extensively against merchants who cheated the poor. This quest shows the systemic nature of injusticeâ€”it's not just individual sin but structural evil. The Orthodox understanding is that faith must lead to justice.
chrysostomQuotes: The rich man is not one who has much, but one who gives much.
Do you pay such honor to your excrements as to receive them into a silver chamber-pot when another man made in the image of God is perishing of cold?
Not to share our own wealth with the poor is theft from the poor and deprivation of their means of life.
thematicNotes.historicalContext: Chrysostom's conflict with the merchants and wealthy of Constantinople was a major factor in his eventual exile. The Empress Eudoxia took his sermons against wealth as personal attacks.
